author: Zachary Shahan
title: Ford F-150 Lightning Makes It To #1 EV Market In The World — How Will It Do?
description: https://www.autocarindia.com/car-news/hyundai-alcazar-facelift-to-launch-by-mid-2024-430732

author: TOI News Desk
title: 'Horse-trading taking place': SC's strong observations in Chandigarh mayoral polls case
description: NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Monday said that the returning officer in Chandigarh Mayoral polls Anil Masih has to be prosecuted as he was interfering with the election process. During the hearing, Anil Masih admitted to tampering saying he put 'X' marks on eight 'defaced' ballot papers. The Supreme Court was hearing a case involving the defeat of AAP-Congress candidate Kuldeep Kumar after eight votes were controversially declared invalid in Chandigarh Mayor polls.

author: Zachary Shahan
title: Premier League: Erik ten Hag wants Manchester United to be more clinical after win over Luton Town
description: Manchester United must become more clinical in front of goal and put teams to the sword, manager Erik ten Hag said after his side squandered a host of chances in Sunday's 2-1 Premier League win at Luton Town. Two early goals from striker Rasmus Hojlund put United in the driver's seat on Sunday but after Carlton Morris halved the deficit in the 14th minute at Kenilworth Road Ten Hag's side were unable to restore their two-goal cushion. The Dutchman told reporters United had been 'fragile' at times after failing to kill the game off.

author: TOI sports desk
title: He's the new Ashwin: Former England captain compares this rookie with star India spinner
description: England experienced their inaugural Test series defeat during the 'Bazball' era as India triumphed with a five-wicket win

author: Vaibhav Tiwari
title: MK Stalin's minister accepts 'small mistake' called out by PM Narendra Modi
description: PM Modi, while addressing a gathering in Tamil Nadu's Tirunelveli, said the DMK government pasted China's sticker to take credit for ISRO's facility.

author: HT Entertainment Desk
title: The Great Indian Kapil Show: Kapil Sharma, Sunil Grover finally reunite for Netflix series. Watch hilarious promo
description: The Great Indian Kapil Show: Kapil Sharma and Sunil Grover have indeed buried the hatchet and reunited for a brand new show for Netflix. On Thursday, Kapil shared the promo for The Great Indian Kapil Show on social media, leaving fans excited to see him with Sunil once again.

author: HT Sports Desk
title: Cameron Green's 'one and half run' move with Josh Hazlewood in record partnership leaves umpires, Tim Southee baffled
description: At 89 for four, Australia were left in a precarious position on Day 1 at the Basin Reserve in Wellington. Mitchell Marsh and Cameron Green put on a counterattacking show in their 67-run stand before it was all about the all-rounder. The New Australia No. 4 notched up his second Test century of his career to hit back at critics.

author: world news
title: 'Nuclear War If...': Putin's Open Threat To West Over Sending Troops To Ukraine
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has issued an ultimatum amid murmurs about NATO troops in Ukraine. Putin said that there was a genuine risk of nuclear war if the West sent its troops. The Russian leader stated that Moscow had the weapons to strike targets in the West. He suggested western leaders did not understand how dangerous their meddling could be in what he cast as Russia's own internal affairs.

author: world news
title: Imran Supporters Turn Pak Parl Into Battleground; Nawaz Heckled, Shoe Hurled AT PML(N) Lawmaker
description: Ruckus and protests erupted in Pakistan National Assembly as supporters of former PM Imran Khan protested alleged election rigging and heckled ex-PM Nawaz Sharif in the House as newly-elected lawmakers took oath on Thursday. Watch what unfolded in the Pakistan National Assembly.

author: sports desk
title: Paul Pogba: It's that drug testosterone again; could end French international's career after doping positive
description: Former Manchester United and current Juventus player Paul Pogba was on Thursday banned from the sport for 4 years due to doping, according to various news outlets.

author: sports desk
title: Cristiano Ronaldo banned for a match after obscene gesture towards fans chanting Lionel Messi's name
description: Cristiano Ronaldo was handed a one-match ban on Thursday after he had made an obscene gesture last Sunday in a Saudi Pro League match against al Shabab. The Portuguese talisman will also have to pay a fine of 20,000 Saudi riyals and can't appeal against the decision, the Disciplinary and Ethics Committee of the Saudi Arabia Football Federation said.

author: Sayak Dutta , Rahul Pandey
title: Unlike Cristiano Ronaldo in Saudi Arabia, here's how brand David Beckham made MLS go big on Lionel Messi
description: The World Cup-winning captain signing for a bottom-tier MLS club sent shockwaves around world football. For Inter Miami co-owner David Beckham though, it was always part of the plan.

author: Sandip G
title: How Xabi Alonso stopped the goal machine Harry Kane against Bayern Munich, and is making heads turn steering the wheel at Bayer Leverkusen
description: After the final whistle blew, capping a symbolic night when Bayer Leverkusen thrashed Bayern Munich to stretch their lead to five on the Bundesliga chart, manager Xabi Alonso dragged his support staff to the middle of the pitch. The Spaniard and his entourage joined the tired but jubilant players in the middle and they walked towards each stand to thank the players.

author: Sandip G
title: Xavi and Barcelona,a marriage made in heaven that ended like a sour divorce
description: Xavi wept the first time he bid goodbye to Barcelona. Those were tears he shed for parting with a slice of his soul, the club he has devoted all his life for, the club he spent his time from adolescence to middle age. The institution had defined him, as much as he had defined it. Those were tears of joy too, for he was departing as a winner, with the European crown on his right hand at the sleek Olympiastadion in Berlin.

author: Paul Adams & David Gritten
title: Israel-Gaza war: More than 100 reported killed in crowd near Gaza aid convoy
description: At least 112 Palestinians are said to have been killed and 760 injured trying to get desperately needed aid in Gaza.Crowds descended on a convoy of lorries on the coastal road south-west of Gaza City, in the presence of Israeli tanks.Israel's military say tanks fired warning shots but did not strike the convoy. Some Palestinians say troops fired directly at them.

author: Frances Mao
title: White Island volcano: Tour operators ordered to pay millions to victims
description: A New Zealand court has ordered NZ$10m (£4.8m; $6m) in compensation to the victims of the White Island volcano disaster, where 22 people died.In December 2019, 47 people were touring the volcano when it erupted, killing nearly half of the group and gravely injuring everyone else.

author: Angus Crawford and Tony Smith
title: Poison seller tied to suicide forum tracked down by BBC
description: A Ukrainian man selling a poison thought to be linked to at least 130 UK deaths has been identified by the BBC.Leonid Zakutenko advertised his services on a website promoting suicide and he told an undercover reporter he sends five parcels a week to the UK.

author: Mariko Oi
title: India economy beats expectations with 8.4% growth
description: India has retained its title of the world's fastest growing major economy as it expanded by 8.4% in the last three months of 2023.The data comes as the country is set to hold a general election this year.

author: Geeta Pandey
title: India: Two children ran away. It took them 13 years to get home again
description: On a hot summer day in June 2010, two Indian children upset with their parents for hitting them left home.The siblings - 11-year-old Rakhi and seven-year-old Bablu - planned to go to their maternal grandparents who lived just a kilometre away. But a few wrong turns and they were lost.
